Package services

Class SearchService

  • java.lang.Object
    • services.SearchService
  • @Singleton
public class SearchService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service for searching videos on YouTube and storing the search results for a user session.

      Indirection level to youtube service search, we store the search results in the correct user session search result list We also handle if a search term has already been made, if so put it back to the top of the list without making a request to the api.

    • Method Detail

      • searchKeywords

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.List<VideoSearch>> searchKeywords​(java.lang.String keywords,
                                                                                          java.lang.String sessionId)
        Indirection level to youtube service search, we store the search results in the correct user session search result list We also handle if a search term has already been made, if so put it back to the top of the list without making a request to the api. Otherwise request from the youtube api. This method also performs sentiment analysis on the list of videos returned by the YouTube search. The sentiment is analyzed to determine the overall mood (happy, sad, or neutral) based on the descriptions of the videos in the result. The result, including the sentiment analysis, is encapsulated in a VideoSearch object and added to the session's search list to the api. Otherwise request from the youtube api
        Parameters:
        keywords - keywords of the search
        sessionId - user session id
        Returns:
        list of the last 10 or less searches made

      • getSessionSearchList

        public java.util.List<VideoSearch> getSessionSearchList​(java.lang.String sessionId)
        Get the search list for a user session, if it doesn't exist create a new one
        Parameters:
        sessionId - user session id
        Returns:
        the video search list for this user

      • getVideoById

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<Video> getVideoById​(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieves a video by its ID.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getVideosBySearchTerm

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<VideoList> getVideosBySearchTerm​(java.lang.String keywords,
                                                                               java.lang.String sessionId)
        Retrieves a list of videos based on the search term. If the search term has already been made in the current session, it returns the cached results. Otherwise, it makes a request to the YouTube API to get the results.
        Parameters:
        keywords - the search terms for the video
        sessionId - the user session id
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture containing the list of videos based on the search term
